Exploring Generating Functions
about generating functions

Learn Generating Functions

I’m going to try to learn how to work with generating functions, and blog about it as I go.

I’m interested in trends, and I have a Python project to explore them. Some statistical facts about trends are combinatorial, and can be understood with statistics of random permutations. Pure-combinatorial arguments give me some results, but many things I find on the internet deduce the same results with generating functions.

    Exploring The MMM1 Text

    I’ll start by browsing Mike Zabrocki’s MMM1 (Mini-Mathematical Monographs), on Ordinary Generating Functions (OGFs). I’ll call it a book, even though it’s on-line and only sixty-two pages – five chapters.
